title: Bard Network Computing Initiative
text:
The goal of the Bard Network Computing Initiative (BNCI) is to support delivery of and expansion of computing and data analysis activities throughout the Bard Network. The Bard Network includes the Bard Early College program and the institutions of the Global Higher Education Alliance for the 21st Century.


What do we do?
Work of the BNCI is support by and carried out in concert with the Computational Sciences program at Bard College. Activities of the BNCI include:

Modules developed for and delivered in courses across the disciplines at Bard College and throughout the network:








Course Title
Module




Intro to Media
Media consolidation, personal data, and algorithmic bias


Epidemics & Society
Modeling and visualization of disease spread and vaccine efficacy


Intro to Community Sciences
Air and water quality data analysis


Problems of Archaeological Archives
Text analysis, expanded spreadsheet analysis


Introduction to Physics
Statistical analysis and data manipulation




Senior project support for students with data analysis challenges
Short courses on Statistics, Geographic Information Systems, Data Visualization
Network Collaborative Courses for students across GHEA21
(planned for Bard College) On-campus Data Analysis Support Center



Whoâ€™s Who
The Director of the BNCI is Valerie Barr, the Margaret Hamilton Distinguished Professor of Computer Science at Bard College.
Jordan Ayala, Visiting Assistant Professor of Data Analytics and Environmental Studies, is a key brain-stormer and contributor to the BNCI, working on development of modules, short courses, and senior project support.
